intro: Bequaertia mucronata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed bequaertia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Bequaertia mucronata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
